intro: Coleus ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori coleus, is a striking ornamental plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Ruwenzori Mountains in Uganda. It is characterized by its vibrant, colorful foliage, which can display shades of red, orange, and purple, making it a popular choice for gardeners. The plant belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, requiring moderate watering to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in specialized gardens.
